greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominators of the sequence whose Dirichlet convolution with itself yields A068068, number of odd unitary divisors of n.
comment: The sequence seems to give the denominators of several other similarly constructed "Dirichlet Square Roots".
Note that A318314 differs from A318454 at exactly those n where A001227 differs from A068068, the numbers in A038838. - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 07 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
formula: a(n) = denominator of f(n), where f(1) = 1, f(n) = (1/2) * (A068068(n) - Sum_{d|n, d>1, d<n} f(d) * f(n/d)) for n > 1.
a(n) = A006519(n) * A317934(n), thus multiplicative with a(2^e) = 2^A005187(e), a(p^e) = 2^A011371(e) for odd primes p.
Equally, multiplicative with a(p^e) = 2^(((2-A000035(p))*e)-A000120(e)) for all primes p.
mathematica: a[n_] := Product[{p, e} = pe; 2^(((2 - a35[p])*e) - a120[e]), {pe, FactorInteger[n]}];
program: DirSqrt(v) = {my(n=#v, u=vector(n)); u[1]=1; for(n=2, n, u[n]=(v[n]/v[1] - sumdiv(n, d, if(d>1&&d<n, u[d]*u[n/d], 0)))/2); u}; \\ From A317937.
(PARI) A318314(n) = { my(f = factor(n), m=1); for(i=1, #f~, m *= 2^(((2-(f[i,1]%2))*f[i,2]) - hammingweight(f[i,2]))); (m); }; \\ (based on a new conjectured formula) _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 03 2018
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_ and _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 29 2018
